0807171-d-07-17-08-MMA.Narrative:
NO 304 WAS TRAVELING SOUTH AT MILE 116.10 WHEN THE CREW LOST THEIR AIR DERAILING 7 LOADS OF PAPER.THREE CARS ON THEIR SIDE AND FOUR UPRIGHT.  THE TRAIN WAS MOVING DOWN A LONG 1%+ GRADE, AT 26 MPH, IN 1.39 DEGREE RIGHT HAND CURVE WITH A 20 POUND TRAIN BRAKE REDUCTION WHEN ONE WHEEL ON GMRC 7050 DERAILED ON HIGH SIDE AT POINT WHERE TRACK STRUCTURE HAD MOVED APPROXIMATELY 8 INCHES TOWARD WEST.  WHEEL RODE APPROXIMATELY 18 INCHES ON BALL OF RAIL BEFORE DROPPING AND CAUSING DERAILMENT.  PRIMARY CAUSE OF DERAILMENT WAS DUE TO EXTREME HEAT WITH SECONDARY CAUSE CONTRIBUTED TO MARGINAL TRACK BALLASTIN AREA. 

OCS TERRITORY

207554-d-07-22-08-SOO.Narrative: WESTBOUND CARRINGTON ROAD SWITCH (ASSIGNMENT H66-22) ARRIVED TO DELIVER 15 EMPTIES. ENGINEER STOPPEDFOR CONDUCTOR TO DETRAIN AT WEST DERAIL ON SOUTH LEAD TRACK. ENGINEER PULLED WEST TO CLEAR THE SWITCH AND CONDUCTOR REMOVED LOCK AND INDICATES HE PLACED WEST DERAIL IN NON-DERAILING POSITION, THEN LINED THE WEST MAIN TRACK SWITCH INTO THE SOUTH LEAD FOR INTENDED SHOVE MOVE. AFTER CONDUCTOR COMMUNICATED WITH ENGINEER THAT THE DERAIL & SWITCH WERE LINED FOR THEIR ROUTE, THE CONDUCTOR INITIATED SHOVE MOVE WITH THE 15 CARS INTO THE CLEAR ON THE SOUTH HOUSE TRACK. THE 810 JOB ASKED IF THE 910 WOULD WATCH THEIR SHOVE AND THEY STATED THEY WERE UNABLE TO WATCH.  810 SHOVED 1 CAR INTO TRACK #8 FOULING THE SOUTH END OF WD08. 73108-d-07-31-08-MVP.Primary Accident Cause: Hand brake (including gear) broken or defective
73108-d-07-31-08-MVP.Contributing Accident Cause: Other brake defects, cars (Provide detailed description in  narrative)
73108-d-07-31-08-MVP.Accident Cause: Hand brake (including gear) broken or defective
73108-d-07-31-08-MVP.Narrative:
AT APPROXIMATELY 1720 HOURS ON 7/31/08 TWO EMPTY RAILCARS, CR 238272 AND NS 486748, ROLLED UNDER THEIR OWN POWER DOWN THE LEAD INTO NUMBER 1712 TRACK AND INTO R-6 STICKING THE BUMPING POST AND THE CEMENT WALL JUST BEHIND IT.  THE CAR DAMAGED THE BUMPING POST BEYOND REPAIR, DAMAGED THE CEMENT WALL AND STRUCK THE ASSEMBLY PLANTS FRAMING TO THE CHAIN THAT DRIVES THE PLANTS ASSEMBLY LINE CAUSING THE PLANT TO SHUT DOWN. 

I WITH THE HELP OF EMPLOYEE FROM PROGRESSIVE RAIL, THE CONDUCTOR AND YARDMASTER AS THE ENGINEER PERFORMED A REENACTMENT OF THE EVENT, FROM 2330 TO 0015 HRS, ON THE SAME TRACK WITH THE SAME CONDUCTOR AND THE SAME TWO CARS. THE CONCLUSION WAS THAT THE HAND BRAKE ON THE NS 486748WOULD NOT HOLD THE TWO EMPTY CARS FROM THE SPOT IN WHICH THEY WERE CUT OFF FROM.  THE HAND BRAKE ONTHE NS 486748 INDEED HAD A MECHANICAL FAILURE.    

AT 0815 HRS ON 8/1/08 THE CHIEF INSPECTOR ANDMECHANICAL INSPECTOR FROM THE FRA ARRIVED AT MVP.  THEY INSPECTED THE CARS AND THE MECHANICAL INSPECTOR FOUND THAT NOT ONLY WAS THE HAND BRAKE ON THE NS 468748 WAS INEFFECTIVE BUT THAT THE SLACK ADJUSTER WAS NOT OPERATING AS INTENDED.  HE STATED "THAT THERE WAS NO WAY THE AIR OR HAND BRAKE WOULD HAVE HELD THE TWO CARS".

BETWEEN 1300 AND 1400 HRS A SECOND REENACTMENT WAS PERFORMED BY MVP AND THE FRA TO FIND THE ROOT CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT. THE RESULTS OF BOTH REENACTMENTS WERE CONCLUSIVE, MECHANICAL FAILURE WAS THE CAUSE FOR THE INCIDENT.
